message: The bridge is no longer passable.
You found a corpse with a loot bag.
You have 'acquired' some gold and other valuable gems!
You've been here before and have already plundered the man's valuables.
Great! Let me see.
I am a rare coin collector. Have you ever noticed how some of your gold is more unique or older looking than others?
Great. Please let me see...agh, interesting.

This one here was cut during the rise of Elythara and is quite rare and valuable. But this other one here is a more common coin as it was cut during Geomyr's rule. While this one here is from a far off land and is a part of a larger collection that has long been broken up by past pirates and thieves.
Where did you get these coins?! [Gylew shows you a set of identical coins]

replies.text: None of your business. Now get to the point.
It was a gift from a friend. Can we get right to what you want?
With all of my coins, do you actually think I can remember?
It was a reward for helping a mermaid.

message: OK, I will get back to my ask of you now.

replies.text: Um, is this going to take long? I have to find my brother.
Interesting, it really is, but I'm leaving.
Interesting. Please enlighten me some more.

message: What?! Seriously?
I must have one.

replies.text: OK. What do you have of value?

message: Here is 500 gold.
That was foolish of you. This is very valuable and you just gave it to me.
Where did you get these coins?! [Gylew shows you a collection of identical coins]

replies.text: I took them off of a dead guy.
I got them from a friend
I don't know. After all, I have looted many a gold coin in my travels.

message: You see, I was raised in Feygard by my father who was commissioned to create gold coins. All he ever talked about was coins and we shared this common love.
He once told me this story when I was very young about this magnificent coin collection called the 'Korhald coins'. So from a very young age I was fascinated.

replies.text: You mentioned 'Korhald coins'. Who or what is 'Korhald'?

message: You never heard of Korhald? He was the founder of Remgard. Anyways, back to my story...
My father never mentioned the exact location to me, but from my efforts, I've ascertained a location near Remgard.

replies.text: Great, I see where this is going. I need to go back to Remgard.

message: It is far east of here near a place called Laeroth Manor.
We have failed to retrieve it as the monsters are too strong. That's where you come in. What do you say? Will you help me?

replies.text: Yes, of course, you you need my help.
Pathetic creatures you two are. Needing the help of a child. I will do it.

message: Yes, a place called Laeroth Manor.
Then please head to the east and return to me when you find the Korhald coins.
We will discuss this after you have completed the job. But remember, I am from Remgard and can reward you handsomly.

replies.text: OK, but I have high expectations. Please be prepared to pay up.

message: Show me your gold.

replies.text: No way. I'm out of here.

message: What?! You went digging through his corpse?
I must have them. All 10 of them!

replies.text: OK. What do you have of value?
Nope. You can not have them.

message: Here is 550 gold
Much appreciated. Thank you.
What are you waiting for? Go find those coins!
Hello. It's so very long since I have seen another person. Who are you, and why are you here?

replies.text: I'm $playername. I'm looking for my Brother, Andor. Have you seen him?

message: No. I just told you that you are the first person I have seen here in a very long time. Getting to the old manor is difficult and dangerous, and there is nothing here. So why would anyone come here?

replies.text: I guess I'll be going then.

message: [Not paying attention, you almost fall.] Oops, I should be more careful.
As you approach the crates, you notice an almost illegible sign hanging on the wall. Upon further examination, you can make out the word 'Korhald'.
The sign has not changed since the last time you read it.
As you approach these crates, you quickly develop an appreciation for their age. You also notice the vast amount of nasty cobwebs surrounding them. Yet something compels you to look further.

replies.text: [I better not. There could be danger lurking inside.]

message: The cobwebs must have been holding this extremely old container together.
Examine the chest?

replies.text: Go for it! This could be the 'Korhald coins'.
No! This may be a trap.

message: [The chest is locked.]
Hey! What do you think you are doing?

replies.text: I am working a job for a man name Gylew.
Um...I am returning something to a man name Gylew.

message: I don't think you want to do that.
Well, for starters, that chest that you are carrying belongs to me.
Because I said it is! Now give me that chest before you get hurt.

replies.text: Don't make me laugh. You hurt me? Do you know who I am? Explain yourself now.
Explain yourself now or Gylew gets his treasure.

message: The story starts many many years ago.

replies.text: [You rudely interrupt] Oh great, please spare me the grandpa story.

message: Anyways...it was back when we were kids. You see, Gylew and I are half-brothers.
We have the same father. After Gylew's mom died of the Great Plague, father traveled to Brightport in search of a new wife.
To " spare you of the grandpa story" as you called it, I will skip details.
Eventually, they were married and I was soon born. Gylew and I were close in age and often got along great.
But father always favored Gylew. They often took long trips in search of exotic and unique coins. I was left out of these adventures most of the time.
I was only allowed to go after mother instisted to father that I go too.

replies.text: What happened to skipping the details?

message: OK...Gylew and father discovered this story of looted gold coins that was rumored to be hidden here in the Laeroth Manor. But neither was strong enough to dare try to retrieve it.
For many years afterwards, this is all the family ever talked about. During this time, my father and I grew a part and eventually, my mother and I left him and returned to her hometown of Brightport.
I was able to make it back to him shortly before his death in an attempt to repair our broken relationship.

replies.text: What happened to skipping the details?

message: Angry with him, I was able to steal this key [Forenza shows you what you suspect is the key to the chest] from his estate before it was given to Gylew.
A few years later I learnt what this key opened and this is why I am here. To my disappointment, I quickly realized I was missing the second key.

replies.text: Where do you think the other key is?
[Sarcasm] I like the 'stories with Grandpa hour'. But seriously, skip the details and tell me where the the other key is.

message: Isn't it obvious? Gylew must have it.

replies.text: You have been wronged by your family and deserve this treasure. I can get Gylew's key for you.
Gylew is the rightful owner of his father's estate and that key belongs to the estate.

message: You will do this for me?
What are you going to do about it?

replies.text: Kill you and take that key!

message: Great. Go to Gylew and get his key. Then bring it and the chest to me. I will meet you outside of Brimhaven.
Hey, kid, nice to see you again.

replies.text: It's nice to see you too.  Can we talk about the Korhald coins?
Hey. I found the Korhald tomb and it had two items that I think might interest you.
Hey. I need to go now and find this map.
We have no more business to discuss. I'll see you later.
I hope that having these coins will enable you to make peace with your father. Take care.

message: [With an ever growing smile upon his face, Forenza inserts the first key and then the second. He then proceeds to slowly open the chest.]
Well, go get it and bring me back both the key and the chest.
[He then begins to feverlessly sift through the coins, transferring each one to his bag. When to his surpirse, he finds something...]
Look at what I found at the bottom of the chest. A pendant and a map. [Shows item to you]

replies.text: A map? Really? Where does it point to?

message: Well, that is really hard to say. You see [he shows you the map], it is really old and a lot of the landmarks no longer exisit in Dhayaver.

replies.text: Yeah, I can see what you mean.

message: But not all hope is lost. You see this may shows the great river that is just right over there [points northeast] behind those trees.Anyone who follows the map going east, should have no problem reaching wherever this map is leading to.
Here, take the map and the pendant. If you need me, I'll be here for a little bit longer.
What? Why? My trusty henchman will take care of you.
Did you find them?

replies.text: Yes, I found the Korhald coins, but you are not getting them...[Attack]
Yes, but I don't have them on me. I will go get them.

message: Great! Let me have it.

[Gylew examines the chest]
What?! There are two locks! How can this be? Do you know anything about a second key?

replies.text: Yes. In fact, I met a 'friend' of yours who told me all about it.

message: And whom may that be?

replies.text: Your half-brother, Forenza. What a story he had to tell.

message: But I see that you did not listen to those 'stories' as you would not be here if you had. What did he tell you about the second key?

replies.text: Well, for starters, he told me that he had and he would not give it to me without a fight. Which of course, we did fight to the death for.

message: You killed my brother?

replies.text: YES, and I loved doing so. Pathetic creature he was.
I was forced to. He gave me no choice.
[Lie] No, but I beat him up good and took his key.

message: I guess I should be saddened, but I am not. Can I have my brother's key now? I've waited a long time for these coins.
Thank you? It is so nice to finally be this close to my life's dream.
Oh, you think you are a funny kid? I see.
The chest is now empty.
You have just found a coin and a shield.
You have just found a coin and a shield.
[The chest is locked.]
[The door is looked, but before dispair sets in, you notice that the keyhole is oddly shaped. You decide to use the Mysterious Korhald 'pendant' as a key.]
[The door is looked! I should go find a key.]
[Let's stop for a second and look at the 'Mysterious Korhald map']
[According to the map, I should continue heading east.]
[I don't have the map. I should go back and get it so that i don't get lost.]
[According to the map, I should continue heading south.]
[At a quick glance, you notice a couple of books on the strategy of war.]
Oh, really?! Let me see them and we can talk more.

replies.text: [You show Gylew the Coin of Prestige and the Shield of the brave]

message: Hmm...these are indeed interesting. Very interesting in fact.

replies.text: [While trying to hold back the giant smile that you can feel growing upon your face, you ask 'why is that?']

message: Well, for starters, this shield has Korhald family crest engraved on it's front side and clearly belonged to Korhald himself, but I have no use for such an item. Here take it.
But this coin you have here is a completely different story. I don't know anything about it. Which makes me want it even more. Can I have it? I will reward you handsomely for it.

replies.text: Reward?! I always love the sound of that. What are we talking here? 10000 godl? 20000 gold?
Here, take it. I have enough coins.

message:
[While laughing]
Now, now, don't get greedy on me. How about 7000 gold and I will tell people we are friends?

replies.text: Sounds like a great deal. I'll take it.
Let me think about it. I will be back shortly.

message: Excellent. Come see me if you ever find any more interesting coins.
OK, but don't keep an old man waiting too long. I want that coin.
Oh, you are so kind. I'll tell you what. Once you find your way to Feygard, seek out my family. They will help you make that shield a little bit better.
Looking to the north, you see more of the manor, the lake, and cliffs beyond that.
You gaze to the east, but there is not much to see. The lake, the shore, but you think you recognize some of the cliffs you had to scale to get here.
Looking to the south, you see the lakeshore you walked along. There is also a tower in the distance. You wonder if at one time the that tower and this one sent signals to each other.
To the west, you see a town on an island. It looks prosperous. In the far disatnce, somewhat to the north, it looks like there is another island, but you can't make out any details.
Do you have Gylew's key?

replies.text: Yes, and I also have the chest. Here, take them. [You give both items to Forenza]
Yes, but I don't have the chest.

message: Oh, really?! Let me see them and we can talk more.

replies.text: [You show Forenza the Coin of Prestige and the Shield of the brave]

message: Hmm...these are indeed interesting. Very interesting in fact.

replies.text: [While trying to hold back the giant smile that you can feel growing upon your face, you ask 'why is that?']

message: Well, for obvious reasons. Didn't you notice that the shield has Korhald family crest engraved on it's front side? This clearly belonged to Korhald himself. You should keep this item as i could aid you in your adventures.

But this coin you have here really gives my pause as I never thought the stories of it's existance was true.  I don't know much about it, but I do know that has great value. Can I have it? I will reward you for it of course.

replies.text: Reward?! I always love the sound of that. What are we talking here? 10000 godl? 20000 gold?
Here, take it. I have enough coins.

message:
[While laughing]
Now, now, who do you think I am, Gylew? I don't have that kind of gold. How about 7000 gold?

replies.text: Sounds like a great deal. I'll take it.
Let me think about it. I will be back shortly.

message: Oh, how very generous of you to just hand it over for free. I'll tell you what once you find your way to Brightport, seek out my family. They will help you reward you for all of your generosity  and hard work.
Excellent. Come see me if you ever find any more interesting coins.
I am Moriath, the caretaker for this manor.

replies.text: Can you tell me more about this place?
If there is nobody else here, why do you stay?

message: This is Laeroth manor. Or what is left of it, anyway.

replies.text: Can you tell me more about this place?

message: Laeroth manor? Yes, of course.

I am bound by an oath to take care of the manor. It is not an oath I ever gave though. 

I cannot care for everything of course. I take care of the main house, the bridges, and tend to the graves as best I can. Everything else has gradually fallen to ruin.

replies.text: How can you be bound by an oath you never gave?

message: It is a matter of honor. The Lord of the manor saved my great-great grandfather from certain death many years ago. In return my great-great grandfather vowed that his family would always look after the manor.

replies.text: He should not have made a vow that bound his family for generations!
Well, that's too bad for you. I need to get going. I have to find my brother.

message: I do not disagree, but he did.

replies.text: Is there something I can do to help?
Too bad. Look on the bright side though. You have an entire manor to yourself. Bye.

message: Many years ago, this island was used as a refuge in times of danger by communities that lived on the lakeshore. There was little here other than a small fortification, but being an island, that was enough for protection.
Then a man by the name of Laeroth, along with a group of followers, declared himself the Lord of Laeroth, and took the fortifications and the island as his own.

For many years his family continued to provide refuge to those that lived on the shore, and they even built a watchtower on the mountain to the south, as a lookout for approaching enemies.
In return, the manor was provided with supplies.

replies.text: Maybe I shouldn't have asked. This is getting boring. I need to leave, and look for my brother.

message: The fall of the manor began when the shore folk built a bridge to an island, and founded the city of Remgard.
Remgard was far from any enemies, and easily defended, so the islands in the lake were no longer important, and the supplies stopped coming.

With no place to grow food on the islands most of the staff left. The last lord that resided here had only one son, and when the lord died his son abandoned the manor and left to look for other opportunities.

replies.text: So if the son has left, why do you stay here?
Thanks for the history lesson. I need to leave, and look for my brother.

message: The only thing that would help is for me to be released from the oath.
The current lord, of course. But he has gone. I do not know his whereabouts, or even if he is still alive. If I knew he was deceased I would consider the oath void, but I do not know that.

Any of the past lords Laeroth could release me from the oath. But, like my great great grandfather, they are long dead. Their graves are in the tomb on the far island. So unless you can raise the dead, they will be of no help.
You look through the shelves, but there does not seem to be anything that would help you here.
You look through the shelves, and one book catches your eye. "A Treatise on Ghosts and Other Undead". Maybe this has the information you seek.

You look at the contents page. There are chapters on zombies, liches, ... wait, what's this?

There is a chapter on spirits of the dead, with a section on raising them! This looks like what you need!
You flip to the section on raising spirits, and start reading.
